title.narrative: Provision of in-camp and out-of-camp CCCM support to conflict-affected populations in Iraq

description.narrative:
Through this 6-month initiative, ACTED will provide first line CCCM response to ensure dignified, safe and livable conditions to highly vulnerable IDPs fleeing from conflict in formal and informal settlements in Ninewa and Salah al Din governorates.
The proposed activities include:
Mitigation of risks and hazards in emergency sites, through identification and referral of risk factors in emergency camps and informal settlements, to partners and clusters Ensuring IDPs have access to life saving assistance and protection, through mapping of service providers, tracking of basic needs, and identification and referral of service gaps in camps, emergency sites and informal sites. Building local CCCM capacity, through training and mentoring to camp management teams of emergency sites or camps Enhancing community participation in decision making processes, through establishing Site Committees in camps, emergency sites and informal sites (Block Leader Committee Women Committee Youth Committee, Maintenance Committee) Provide tools and information to displaced populations to carry out their own clean up and risk reduction Improvement of communal site infrastructure, and reduction of environmental risks and hazards, through community-based site maintenance, and protection mainstreaming into camp infrastructure.
Through a comprehensive, and flexible approach, ACTED will contribute to reaching as many people as possible across Iraq, continuing its current CCCM activities through the deployment of five teams: three static teams operating in Mosul emergency camps and two mobile teams covering formal camps and informal settlements in Zone North, East, West for Mosul response and Shirqat district for Hawiga response. Specifically, the project locations include 8 Mosul Response Emergency Camps: Salamiyah MoDM Salamiyah UNHCR Nargizlia 1 Nargizlia 2 Zelika Khazir M Hasansham U Hasansham M2
Plus 5,000 beneficiaries living in informal settlements, which will be selected from abandoned buildings, collective centers and critical shelters.
The proposed activities contribute towards a project awarded to ACTED by UNHCR: direct Camp Management of Al Salamiyah Camp. This project provides 20% of the funding for the direct Camp Management of Al Salamiyah Camp.
121,000 vulnerable individuals will benefit from the CCCM services provided by ACTED through the proposed initiative. These will include 24,682 women, 24,270 men, 34,630 girls, and 37,418 boys between IDPs and members of the host community.
Finally, the proposed activities are part of ACTED’s mobile intervention, which provides a comprehensive response including CCCM, WASH, Shelter and Non-food Items (NFIs), and child protection. This multi-sectorial and integrated approach aims at responding to the emergency that will unfold following the military operations on Mosul City and Hawiga.
